body.name: Garmin Drive™ 53 GPS Navigator, High-Resolution Touchscreen, Simple On-Screen Menus and Easy-to-See Maps, Driver Alerts
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 18 hrs 19 mins
features: Bright, high-resolution 5” glass capacitive touchscreen display lets you easily view your route
Get more situational awareness with alerts for school zones, speed changes, sharp curves and more
View food, fuel and rest areas along your active route, and see upcoming cities and milestones
View Tripadvisor traveler ratings for top-rated restaurants, hotels and attractions to help you make the most of road trips
Directory of U.S. national parks simplifies navigation to entrances, visitor centers and landmarks within the parks
Includes detailed map updates of the North America
Provides spoken turn-by-turn directions with Garmin Real Directions landmark guidance feature
body.description: Simplify your drive with Garmin Drive™ 53, the 5” GPS navigator that helps you reach your destination. It features a bright 5” high-resolution glass touchscreen display and modern, beautiful design. With driver alerts, gain more situational awareness for sharp curves, speed changes, school crossings and more. Garmin Drive 53 shows food, fuel and rest stops along your active route. Make the most of road trips by checking the included Tripadvisor® traveler ratings for top-rated restaurants, hotels and attractions. Use the U.S. national parks directory to find visitor centers and notable landmarks within the parks. The Garmin Drive 53 navigator also includes detailed map updates of North America.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us We make products that are engineered on the inside for life on the outside. We do this so our customers can make the most of the time they spend pursuing their passions. Our Mission To be an enduring company by creating superior products for automotive, aviation, marine, outdoor, and sports that are an essential part of our customers’ lives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great unit. Small, compact and works perfectly. Easy to follow instructions on setup and use. Is exactly was I was looking for and my needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for my out of state travel
reviews.reviewText: I previously had a Garmin Nuvi 2577 and this one is very similar except it seems faster. Otherwise, it operates very similarly. Travel ETA works well - provided you're not in an area with heavy traffic on a regular basis. Drove with this en route to LAX on a Saturday and the ETA would update back and forth on a regular basis by as much as 30 minutes. Let's not put too much of that on Garmin though. My passenger was checking similar on google maps at the same time and it was back and forth too. But FYI.Meanwhile, with my Nuvi, I would routinely load 'points of interest' (POI) using Garmin's separate loader for such things. Worked great. Problem with the Drive 53 is though that loading POI only works if you're using a Windows machine to load them. I'm mainly an Apple Mac user though. Didn't work with my macbook pro. Garmin support said try on Windows. I happen to also have an old Windows machine too so I did. That worked. Garmin needs to put the POI loading capability into Garmin Express. Why is it done with a separate app? and now only working for Windows users?My old Nuvi 2577 came with both US and European maps loaded. This one only has US maps. Bummer. To get the EU maps, that'll be another $100. Why so much more?!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Targets my destination rapidly.
reviews.reviewText: The display is easy to read while driving and includes help warnings like speed limit changes, school zones and upcoming railroad tracks. The online videos instruction are helpful, but they caution that the maps should not be updated using satellite internet, which all I have to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clear and suitable for purpose
reviews.reviewText: Very nice upgrade to my older Garmin that ran out of memory. The screen is much easier to read, and I easily added a 32 GB memory card to it to ensure it would serve my needs for years to come. I did not want to upgrade, but I am glad that I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't work very well
reviews.reviewText: This is very difficult to program saved destinations. My old Garmin GPS was much easier to program. The only reason I bought a newer one was the old one was slow. I tried using Garmin Express to transfer from my old Garmin to my new Garmin. That didn't work. I then started to enter addresses manually. Got about half done and all the entered addresses in the GPS disappeared save for four of them. Beyond the return date. Garmin is ahead $169 and I have a useless GPS.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and excellent quality

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good and bad
reviews.reviewText: Have used multiple Garmins for many years. One finally died so bought this one. Screen clarity is better than prior models. Seems to boot up a bit faster as well. Functionality is more complex than previous models are they have crammed new features into this model (too many in my opinion). Some changes make the model harder to use than older ones. I imagine I will get used to it. One oddity, typically the unit is mounted in the center area of a windshield. Many function buttons are now on the left side vs formally right. Feels odd as you loose visibility of the screen in this operating method.All in all, looks pretty good however more complicated to use compared to older models. Weather it be the latest version of Windows or this Garmin, software engineers continue to “improve” products by making them less functional.

reviews.reviewTitle: Garmin Smart Drive 53: Your Ultimate Navigation Companion
reviews.reviewText: The Garmin Smart Drive 53 has truly revolutionized my driving experience. Its intuitive interface and precise navigation make every journey a breeze. The device's clear and vibrant display ensures easy readability, even in varying lighting conditions. I appreciate the timely traffic updates and the accurate route suggestions, helping me avoid congestion and save time on the road. The voice commands are a handy feature, promoting a hands-free and safer driving experience. Overall, the Garmin Smart Drive 53 has exceeded my expectations, proving to be an indispensable companion for any road trip.
Works. Very light and feels cheap. Was going to return it until fiddled with it and found out how to set points.

reviews.reviewTitle: Taking some time to set up.
reviews.reviewText: Hopefully I will get this item to work and take me across the USA. At the moment it is limited to 3 neighboring states only.

reviews.reviewTitle: What was wrong with the old interface?
reviews.reviewText: it works like the old ones did (I have has three over the years)This one is awkward, but not awkward enough to not use it. I may get used to it.
